Package com.src.business

Class InputFileReader

java.lang.Object
com.src.business.InputFileReader
public class InputFileReader
extends java.lang.Object
Author:
Mihnea This class handles the processing of the input Files. There are two types of input files: Store information Files, and Order information Files. We suppose that all the Files are in the same folder.

  • Constructor Details

    • InputFileReader

      public InputFileReader​(java.lang.String folderPath, DBUtils utils) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      The public constructor of this class. After receiving the folder's name, it proceeds to populate its two File arrays with the Files it finds in the folder that satisfy the naming conventions for our two types of Files.
      Parameters:
      folderPath - - the path to the folder containing the Files we are going to process
      utils - - the database access, coming down from the application's driver class
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - - if the folder does not exist

  • Method Details

    • processInput

      public void processInput() throws java.io.IOException, java.text.ParseException
      The "main" method of the class, it starts the process of reading the input Files. The File names do hold significant information. For the Store information Files, they provide the name of the Store. For the Order information Files, they provide the name of the customer, and also the Date of the Order, which is to be parsed.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - - something went wrong creating the FileReader, or propagated from the called methods
      java.text.ParseException - - the Date in the name of the Order information File can not be parsed

    • processOrderFile

      public void processOrderFile​(java.io.BufferedReader reader, java.lang.String customerName, java.util.Date orderDate) throws java.io.IOException
      Method handling the processing of the Order information Files. In case reading exceptions are thrown, the stack trace is printed and the processing moves on.
      Parameters:
      reader - - the already opened BufferedReader for the File of interest
      customerName - - the name of the customer, which we determined when the File was opened
      orderDate - - the Date of the Order, which we determined when the File was opened
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - - in case the BufferedReader can not be closed

    • processStoreFile

      public void processStoreFile​(java.io.BufferedReader reader, java.lang.String storeName) throws java.io.IOException, java.text.ParseException
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.text.ParseException
